script_en: Eating brown rice and legumes? That's like throwing away all the minerals you've carefully consumed. Phytic acid is stealing your nutrients. Phytic acid is a compound found in the outer layers of grains and legumes. It strongly binds to essential minerals like zinc, magnesium, iron, and calcium through a chemical reaction called 'chelation'. Once bound, minerals can no longer be absorbed in the intestines. The more brown rice you eat, the more malnourished you become. They say 'soak for 12 hours to reduce phytic acid,' but it can never be completely removed. And in a carnivore diet, phytic acid doesn't exist at all. Beef contains all essential minerals in a bioavailable form. Stop eating brown rice and eat meat instead, and all your nutritional problems will be solved.
